attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
In a month in which the government has bailed out banks and building societies (using tax payer money) to the tune of billions of pounds, it has been revealed that after a hundred years of the state pension over 2.5 million older people are living below the official poverty line. 

This is a disgraceful situation, and Pensions.co.uk are petitioning government to support pensioners and trade unions who are calling for the basic state pension to be raised above the poverty level. 

We, the electorate, need to be given the right to vote on issues relating to tax payer money. Bailing out bankers, whose greed has created the economic crisis facing the country, is not acceptable when elderly people are facing a bleak retirement. Elderly people need relative comfort and security – which should be provided by a state pension
